intro: Melampyrum vaudense, commonly known as the Vaud yellowtop, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to September. It grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its leaves are simple and alternate, and it has a fibrous root system adapted to its specific ecological niche.
